title: How to solve absolute value equations - Quora

response.answer_text: For an equation , remove the modulus function and replace with . Then check all of your solutions in the original equation. Half of them shouldn’t work as they’re outside the range of the function (but are solutions when you pretend they’re two separate functions). Keep the ones that still work. A graph will likely help.

Proceed case by case. Solve the different cases in which the expressions in the absolute value brackets are negative, zero, and positive separately. Then try to combine your results meaningfully; contradictions mean that the solution doesn’t work.
